member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: AreClose - Returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the AreClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThan - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThan comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.IsZero(System.Double)
member.summary: IsZero - Returns whether or not the double is "close" to 0. Same as AreClose(double, 0), but this is faster.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the IsZero comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan - Returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the LessThan comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Pivot.LayoutDoubleUtil.LessThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is less than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the LessThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred top-level font family for the System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Media.FontFamily object specifying the preferred font family, or a primary preferred font family with one or more fallback font families. The default is the font determined by the System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontFamily value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-level font size for the System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: The desired font size to use in device independent pixels). The default is determined by the System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontSize value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-level font-stretching characteristics for the System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: A member of the System.Windows.FontStretch class specifying the desired font-stretching characteristics to use. The default is System.Windows.FontStretches.Normal.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-level font style for the System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: A member of the System.Windows.FontStyles class specifying the desired font style. The default is determined by the System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontStyle value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-level font weight.
member.returns: A member of class specifying the desired font weight. The default is determined by the System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontWeight value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets the to apply to the text contents.
member.returns: The brush used to apply to the text contents. The default is System.Windows.Media.Brushes.Black.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the thickness of padding space between the boundaries of the content area, and the content displayed by a System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Thickness structure specifying the amount of padding to apply, in device independent pixels. The default is System.Double.NaN.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text contents of a System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.
member.returns: The text contents of this System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock. Note that all non-text content is stripped out, resulting in a plain text representation of the System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock contents. The default is System.String.Empty.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.LightTextBlock.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the horizontal alignment of text content.
member.returns: One of the System.Windows.TextAlignment values that specifies the desired alignment. The default is System.Windows.TextAlignment.Left.
